intro: Lysimachia haupuensis, commonly known as the Kauaʻi ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Kauaʻi. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and streamside habitats. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are often hairy. Lysimachia haupuensis is considered a rare and endemic species, highlighting its ecological significance to the unique flora of Hawaii.
